instruction: Summarize the main points of the text.
output: The text discusses the use of active satellites in providing services to various entities. It focuses on the short-term and long-term physical and economic dynamics of perfectly-competitive open-access and socially-optimal orbit use in a physically-general environment where Kessler Syndrome can occur over multiple periods. The text also considers the impact of debris accumulation and general orbital regions, and provides estimates of the time until Kessler Syndrome occurs. The analysis generalizes previous studies by allowing non-stationary dynamics and runaway debris growth, and clarifies the sources of external effects by considering the economics of general forms of couplings between physical state variables. The text also considers the impact of policy instruments on orbital-use management.
